lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Yilia_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Yilia.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Yilia.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
# Checks that all text files end with a newline.
# Preserve filename with spaces by only splitting on newlines.
print "ERROR", $1, $2, " prohibited \\r\\n line ending, use \\n instead."
# Only warn for markdown files (*.md) to accomodate text editors
# which do not properly handle trailing whitespace.
# Runs all check-* scripts, and returns a non-zero exit code if any of them fail.
* Represents a chat box to complete given commands.
* Runs the main body of the chat box.
* Represents the parser to parse text to other meaning types.
* @throws YiliaException  If the command is unknown to Yilia.
* @throws NoIndexException  If the index is not given by users.
public static Command parse(String text) throws DescriptionEmptyException, KeywordMissingException,
* parses the text into boolean values.
* @param num The text representing a number.
* Represents the storage to load and save data.

* @throws IOException  If the file has an error.
* Saves tasks into a local file.
* @throws IOException  If the file has an error.
public void save(TaskList tasks) throws IOException {
* Represents four different types of a task.
* Represents the user interface to interact with users.
* Greets users by rendering a welcome message.
System.out.println("Hello! I'm Yilia\n" + logo + "What can I do for you?");
* Returns a string from user input.
* @return The text read from user input.
* Shows the status of successfully unmarking a task as not done.
* Shows the status of successfully adding a task into the task list.
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task:\n  " + tasks.get(tasks.size())
+ "\nNow you have " + tasks.size() + (tasks.size() < 2 ? " task" : " tasks") + " in the list.");
* Shows the status of successfully marking a task as done.
* @param task The task whose marking status is shown.
System.out.println("Nice! I've marked this task as done:\n  " + task);
* Shows the status of successfully unmarking a task as not done.
* @param task The task whose unmarking status is shown.
System.out.println("Nice! I've marked this task as done:\n  " + task);
* Shows the status of successfully deleting a task.
public void showDeleteStatus(Task task, TaskList tasks) {
System.out.println("Noted. I've removed this task:\n  " + task + "\nNow you have "
* Shows the content of a task.
* @param index The index of the task.
public void showTask(int index, TaskList tasks) {
System.out.println("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");

public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws DescriptionEmptyException, TimeFormatException {

* Represents an exception to be thrown when the description of a task is empty.
return "☹ OOPS!!! The description of " + (type == Type.EVENT ? "an " : "a ")
* Represents an exception to be thrown when keyword is not given.

return "Please specify the index of items to " + operation;

return "Please input a date in the correct format";

* Represents a task that has a deadline.
* Class constructor specifying the content and date.

* Represents a task that has takes place at a certain time.

* Represents a task list that contains a lot of tasks.
* Returns the size of the task list.

private final Deadline deadline1 = new Deadline("climb the mountain", "2021-01-23");
private final Deadline deadline2 = new Deadline("hand in the assignment", true, "2022-05-22");
assertEquals(deadline2.toString(), "[D][X] hand in the assignment (by: May 22 2022)");
private final Event event1 = new Event("go to the park", "2019-03-12");
private final Event event2 = new Event("go to the concert", true, "2020-01-02");
assertEquals(event1.toString(), "[E][ ] go to the park (at: Mar 12 2019)");
assertEquals(event2.toString(), "[E][X] go to the concert (at: Jan 2 2020)");
private final Todo todo1 = new Todo("go to the park", true);
private final Todo todo2 = new Todo("return a book");
